intro: Grevillea reptans, commonly known as the emu bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, climbing or trailing stems and its showy, red or orange flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, typical of the Proteaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Grevillea reptans is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract birds and insects.
